directives.title: Supraglottic Airway
directives.indications:
• Height >= 122 cm (48 inches)
• Need for ventilatory assistance OR airway control
• Other airway management is inadequate OR ineffective OR unssuccesful
directives.contraindications:
• Intact gag reflex
• Caustic ingestion
• Active vomiting
directives.clinical:
• Endotracheal intubation is usually preffered for secure airway management for ACP(f), CCP
• The supraglottic airway would be considered a rescue device if BLS airway/ventilation and other advanced airway maneuvers have failed
• Confirm placement (i.e. auscultation/ETCO2)

drug_cards.title: Supraglottic Airway
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Insert Airway
MAX 2 attempts

If two (2) patient attempts at supraglottic airway have failed, then revert to BVM and oral/nasal pharyngeal airway management

directives.title: Pre-Intubation and Intubation Medications
directives.treatment: It is expected that in virually ALL circumstances the Paramedic will patch to the TMP prior to performing a Ketamine Dissociated Intubation (KDI) or Sedation Facilitated Intubation (SFI) but it is recognized that there may be rare circumstances in which a patient requires immediate intubation with sedation/dissociation and a timely patch cannot be completed. In this circumstance utilize the medication guidelines below to perform the intubation and patch as soon as possible.
directives.indications: • Intubation attemps
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• See specific contraindications for medications below
directives.clinical:
• RSI Intubation falls under the CCP and PCCP/PCCN scope
• If patient requires recurrent doses of phenylephrine to maintain adequate MAP consult the TMP

drug_cards.title: Lidocaine (Xylocaine) Spray*
drug_cards.doseInformation:
10 mg/spray onto the pharynx, hypopharynx
MAX cumulative dose of 5 mg/kg or 400 mg
drug_cards.notes: *Consider Lidocaine for oro-tracheal facilitated and awake intubations

drug_cards.title: Ketamine (Ketalar)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Induction dose: 1-2 mg/kg IV over 30 seconds

Reduced titration dose:
Push escalating doses 10-30 mg IV q 60 seconds
Goal 2 mg/kg within 5 minutes

Crashing pre-arrest patient
Poor cardiovascular reserve
Potential difficult airway with awake intubation

drug_cards.title: Midazolam (Versed)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.1 mg/kg IV (to a MAX of 8 mg)
contraindicated if MAP < 80
Titrating doses (up to the above doses) in potentially difficult airway for awake intubation (1-2 mg every 3-5 minutes)

drug_cards.title: Etomidate (Amidate)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 0.2-0.3 mg/kg IV/IO

drug_cards.title: Propofol (Diprivan)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
1.0-1.5 mg/kg IV/IO
Contraindicated if MAP < 100
drug_cards.notes:
CAUTION:
• Respiratory apnea and hypotension may occur with rapid induction
• Avoid in elderly or hypovolemia or poor cardiovascular reserve
• Phenylephrine should be used to support BP if hypotension occurs
• Should be avoided in hypotension with head injury

drug_cards.title: fentaNYL (Sublimaze)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 1-2 mcg/kg IV/IO if MAP > 80
drug_cards.notes: Avoid or reduced titration dosage (25-50 mcg IV q 3-5 minutes) if elderly, decreased LOC, or maximally sympathetically stimulated and poor cardiovascular reserve

drug_cards.title: Succinylcholine (Anectine)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 1.5 mg/kg IV/IO
drug_cards.notes:
Contraindicate with:
• Malignant hyperthermia
• Hyperkalemia (known or concern)
• Myopathies/Muscular dystrophies
• Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis, Multiple Sclerosis
• Guillain-Barre Syndrome, botulism
• Burns >= 2nd degree over 10% BSA > 24 hours until healed
• Stroke with hemiparesis, spinal cord injury > 72 hours until 6 months post inury
• Severe intra-abdominal sepsis > 72 hours until resolution

drug_cards.title: Rocuronium (Zemuron)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 1.2 mg/kg IV/IO

drug_cards.title: Phenylephrine (Neosynephrine)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP < 65
MAP < 80 (high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)

100 mcg IV/IO q 3 minutes PRN
MAX 3 doses (300 mcg)

directives.title: Pre-Transfer Sedation
directives.indications:
For a patient demonstrating or verbalizing the symptoms of transfer anxiety and:
	• GCS of 15
	• MAP >= 70 mmHg
	• No concurrent sedation or parenteral analgesia being administered
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication

drug_cards.title: LORazepam (Ativan)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
1 mg PO/SL
MAX dose 1 mg

directives.title: Analgesia: Moderate to Severe Pain
directives.treatment: Patch when maximum amount given or for any other concerns
directives.indications: • All patients should be assessed for level of pain using a 10 point scale (0 = no pain while 10 = maximum pain)
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
directives.clinical: • Total acetaminophen dose is not to exceed the lesser of 75 mg/kg or 4 grams in 24 hours

drug_cards.title: Toradol (Ketoralac)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 30 mg IM
drug_cards.notes: Contraindication: imparied renal function, active bleeding, NSAID in the past 4-6 hours

drug_cards.title: Toradol (Ketoralac)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 30 mg IV/IM
drug_cards.notes: Contraindication: imparied renal function, active bleeding, NSAID in the past 4-6 hours

drug_cards.title: Acetaminophen (Tylenol)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
40 to 60 kg
15 mg/kg PO q 4 hours PRN

>= 60 kg
975-1000 mg PO/PR q 4 hours prn
MAX 75 mg/kg OR 4 grams in 24 hours
drug_cards.notes: Contraindication: acetaminophen within the last 4 hours

drug_cards.title: fentaNYL (Sublimaze)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 70
MAP > 80 (high ICP, ischemic stroke, or spinal cord injury)

25-50 mcg IV/IO q 10 minutes prn
MAX 300 mcg

drug_cards.title: Morphine
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 70
MAP > 80 (high ICP, ischemic stroke, or spinal cord injury)

2-4 mg IV/IO q 20 minutes prn
MAX 10 mg

drug_cards.title: Ketamine (Ketalar)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.1 mg/kg IV/IO q 5 minutes prn
MAX 0.5 mg/kg IV
MAP > 60
drug_cards.notes: Ketamine is not a first line agent for analgesia in normotensive patients but can be considered early for multiple trauma patients or those with concerning hemodynamic status

directives.title: Sedation and Pain Management For Intubated and Ventilated Patients
directives.treatment:
Infusions are preferred to repeat bolus dosing for sedation and analgesia wherever possible. A bolus dose of sedation or analgesia should only be considered when infusion dosing is increased and rapid therapeutic effect is required. Caution should be used with bolus dosing as this may increase the risk of sedation induced hypotension. All mechanically ventilated patients should receive analgesia with either Ketamine or FentaNYL

May choose and give ONE analgesic along with ONE of the following sedative agents; patch when maximum amount given, or for any other concerns
directives.indications: • When a patient is clinically stable, intubated and mechanically or manually ventilated, the ACP(f), and CCP may administer the following for sedation and analgesia
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
directives.clinical:
• All patients (intubated or non-intubated) receiving sedation must be constantly monitored using a continues ETCO2 gas-sampling device that displays both a value and waveform, and have sedation and pain score documented q 30 minutes throughout transport
• For recurrent hypotension requiring intervention, TMP contact is recommended

drug_cards.title:
fentaNYL (Sublimaze) if MAP > 70
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
50-100 mcg IV/IM prn q 5 minutes, maximum cumulative dose for boluses as above cannot exceed 3 mcg/kg/hr
OR
Initiate IV infusion 1-3 mcg/kg/hr

drug_cards.title:
fentaNYL (Sublimaze) if MAP > 70
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
50-100 mcg IV/IM prn q 5 minutes, maximum cumulative dose for boluses as above cannot exceed 3 mcg/kg/hr
OR
Initiate IV infusion 1-3 mcg/kg/hr

drug_cards.title:
Midazolam (Versed) if MAP > 70
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
1-2 mg IV prn q 5 minutes, MAX dose 0.15 mg/kg/hr
OR
Initiate IV infusion 0.05-0.15 mg/kg/hr

drug_cards.title:
Midazolam (Versed) if MAP > 70
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
1-2 mg IV prn q 5 minutes, MAX dose 0.15 mg/kg/hr
OR
Initiate IV infusion 0.05-0.15 mg/kg/hr

drug_cards.title:
Propofol (Diprivan) if MAP > 70
** Caution in elderly patients **
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Titration of the infusion is preferred:
Infusion
0-80 mcg/kg/min IV
Titrate in increments of 5 mcg/kg/min q 5 minutes prn if MAP > 70

Bolus
10-20 mg IV q 5 minutes prn if rapid effect is required, and as long as MAP > 70 mmHg
drug_cards.notes: Excercise caution as bolus doses increase risk of hypotension

drug_cards.title:
Ketamine (Ketalar) if MAP > 60
(if MAP < 60 Mandatory patch*)
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Infusion
0.3-2.0 mg/kg/hr

Bolus
1-2 mg/kg IV over 1 minute x 1 dose followd by 0.5 mg/kg q 20 minutes

drug_cards.title:
Ketamine (Ketalar) if MAP > 60
(if MAP < 60 Mandatory patch*)
(MAP > 80 if high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Infusion
0.3-2.0 mg/kg/hr

Bolus
1-2 mg/kg IV over 1 minute x 1 dose followd by 0.5 mg/kg q 20 minutes
drug_cards.notes: *If MAP < 50 patch to consider other therapies

drug_cards.title:
Phenylephrine (Neosynephrine)
Treatment of hypotension associated with sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP < 65
MAP < 80 (high ICP, ischemic stroke or spinal cord injury)

100 mcg IV/IO x 3 q 3 minutes prn
MAX 300 mcg
drug_cards.notes: *If MAP < 50 patch to consider other therapies

directives.title: Adult - Bronchoconstriction
directives.indications:
• Respiratory distress 
AND 
• Suspected bronchoconstriction
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication 
• Allergy to peanuts (i.e. Ipratropium Bromide (Atrovent)
directives.clinical:
• MDI delivery systems require 30 seconds to 're-charge' between doses. Not waiting the recommended length of time between doses will result in significantly decreased amounts of medication being delivered

• In the event of a respiratory outbreak as identified by originating facility / Ornge, the MDI must be used insead of nebulization

• Side effects of Magnesium Sulfate included hypotension, monitor BP closely

• Consider applying the bronchoconstriction medical directive in both invasive and non-invasive ventilated patients

drug_cards.title:
Salbutamol (Ventolin) MDI
(100 mcg/puff)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
8 puffs
(4 breaths or 45 seconds between each administration)
may repeat x 3 q 5-15 minutes prn

drug_cards.title:
Salbutamol (Ventolin) Solution
Via Nebulized Aerosol (2.5 mg/2.5 ml
drug_cards.doseInformation: 5 mg q 5-15 minutes x 3 prn
drug_cards.notes: *Total volume of Salbutamol and Normal Saline should be 3 ml

drug_cards.title:
Ipratropium Bromide (Atrovent) MDI
(20 mcg/puff)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5 puffs
(4 breaths or 45 seconds between each administration)
may repeat x 3 q 15 minutes prn
MAX 3 doses

drug_cards.title:
Ipratropium Bromide (Atrovent) Solution
Via Nebulized Aerosol (250 mcg/ml)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
500 mcg q 15 minutes x 3 prn
MAX 3 doses
drug_cards.notes: *Total volume of Ipratropium Bromide (Atrovent) and Normal Saline should be 3 ml

drug_cards.title: Epinephrine (Adrenalin)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.01 mg/kg IM (1:1000)
MAX 0.5 mg IM
drug_cards.notes: Use with caution when comorbid history of CAD/Stroke

drug_cards.title: Epinephrine (Adrenalin)
drug_cards.doseInformation: 0.05-0.5 mcg/kg/min IV/IO

drug_cards.title: Steroids
drug_cards.doseInformation:
methylPREDNISolone 125 mg IV/IO
OR
Dexamethasone 8 mg IM/IV/IO

drug_cards.title: Magnesium Sulfate
drug_cards.doseInformation: MAX 2 g IV/IO over 15 minutes

drug_cards.title: Salbutamol (Ventolin) IV Infusion
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5 mcg/min
MAX recommended dose 50 mcg/min

drug_cards.title: Salbutamol (Ventolin) IV Push
drug_cards.doseInformation:
4 mcg/kg IV/IO over 2-5 minutes q 15 minutes
single MAX dose of 250 mcg
Titrate to an airway pressure < 30 mmHg

directives.title: Tension Pneumothorax
directives.indications:
• Severe respiratory distress in the setting of chest trauma with hemodynamic compromise
AND/OR
• Traumatic VSAs
AND/OR
• Severe hemodynamic compromise during positive pressure ventilation particularly in trauma or asthma or COPD patients
AND/OR
• Chest trauma, Severe Asthma or COPD and one or more of the following
   ◦ Decreased/absent breath sounds
   ◦ Altered LOC
   ◦ Cyanosis
   ◦ JVD
   ◦ Hyper resonance on affected side
   ◦ Tracheal shift (late sign)
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable

drug_cards.title: Needle Decompression
drug_cards.doseInformation: Consider differential diagnosis and decompress if high probability of tension pneumothorax

directives.clinical:
• The patient must be seen as soon as possible at an appropriate facility for the insertion of chest tube(s)
• Consider differential diagnosis
   ◦ Mainstem intubation
   ◦ Pleural effusion
   ◦ Hemothorax
   ◦ Consolidated pneumonia
   ◦ Autopeep
   ◦ Dynamic hyperinflation

directives.title: Maintenance of Chest Tubes
directives.indications: • Initiated by sending facility
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable

drug_cards.title: Maintain chest drainage systems during call to keep the drainage system clear
drug_cards.doseInformation:
• If the patient's chest tube was maintained by suction at the sending facility, the Paramedic may maintain suction to no greater than -20 cmH20
• If the patient's chest tube was maintained by gravity drainage, the Paramedic may maintain by gravity drainage to underwater seal or to suction as per patient presentation

directives.clinical:
• A Heimlich flutter valve may be adequate if no drainage system has been implemented
• Suction beyond -20 cmH20 requires patch authorization prior to transport

directives.title: Initiating or Maintaining Mechanical Ventilation
directives.indications:
• Need for mechanical ventilation
	• Hypoxemic respiratory failure
	• Hypercapnic respiratory failure
	• Mixed hypoxemic hypercapnic respiratory failure
	• ETI airway mangagement for transport
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable

drug_cards.title: Assessment and preparation of ventilated patient
drug_cards.notes: * Predicted body weight and tidal volume charts have been provided in the drug monograph document

directives.title: Non-Invasive Positive Pressure Ventilation (NIPPV)
directives.indications: • Conscious patient able to protect airway in respiratory distress
directives.contraindications:
• Active vomiting
• Unable to manage secretions / Inability to protected airway
• Decreased level of consciousness/severe agitation
• Repeated hemoptysis
• Cardiac arrest
• Immediate need for endotracheal intubation
• Apnea
• Upper airway obstruction
• Facial trauma
• Recent esophagostomy

Relative Contraindication:
• Hemodynamic instability

drug_cards.title: CPAP/BiPAP
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Initial Setting
iPAP 10 cmH20/ePAP 5 cmH20

MAX iPAP 20 cmH20/ePAP 10 cmH20
drug_cards.notes:
• Patch first if the patient has altered mentation or is lethargic
• NPPV may be of benefit in hypercarbia from ventilatory failure even with altered mental status
• For agitated patients consider TMP discussion for sedation

directives.title: Post Intubation Paralysis
directives.indications:
• Patients with known difficult airways
• Facilitate and optimize mechanical ventilation and oxygenation for transport
• Sedation and analgesia must be administered in conjunction with muscle relaxation
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• Inadequate sedation/analgesia
directives.clinical:
• In patient with known difficult airways, muscle relaxation is stronly recommended post intubation to ensure minimal risk for loss of ETT in transport
• Complete history and physical examination (including baseline neurologic assessment) must be completed
• Baseline assessment of vitals and level of paralysis should be obtained and documented to detect and record the patient’s subsequent response to paralysis
• Muscle relaxans will hide the motor component of seizures. In cases of status epilepticus or risk of seizures, use paralysis as a last resort and in conjunction with anticonvulsant/sedative infusions. Monitor for autonomic manifestations of seizures
• Proper securing of the ETT is paramount

drug_cards.title: Rocuronium (Zemuron)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.6 mg/kg IV/IO
then
0.3 mg/kg IV/IO q 20 minutes prn

directives.title: Adult Non-Traumatic Cardiac Arrest
directives.indications: • Adult patient is vital signs abset (VSA) due to non-traumatic cause
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable
directives.clinical: • PCP(f) may apply the Medical Directives for management of cardiac arrest with semi-automated defibrillation

drug_cards.doseInformation: Initiate the appropriate algorithm based on the presenting ECG rhythm (see flowchart)
Initiate the appropriate algorithm based on the presenting ECG rhythm (see flowchart)

directives.title: Adult Severe Hypothermic Cardiac Arrest
directives.indications: • Adult patient to be vital signs absent (VSA) and Hypothermic defined as temperature < 30 C, or presumed to be so based on environmental circumstances.
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable

directives.title: Adult Post Arrest Return of Spontaneous Circulation (ROSC)
directives.indications: • ROSC
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable

drug_cards.doseInformation: Initiate the appropriate treatment based on algorithm (see flowchart)

directives.title: Acute Coronary Syndrome
directives.indications: • Suspected cardiac ischemia
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• Patient has used any phosphodiesterase-5 inhibitors (Sildenagil [Viagra or Revatio], tadalafil [Cialis], or Vardemafil [Levitra]) in the last 48 hours (these agents are commonly used for erectile dysfunction and are also used in pulmonary hypertension)
directives.clinical: • In the setting of acute coronary syndrome fentaNYL is the preferred analgesic

drug_cards.title: Nitroglycerin SL *
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 70
0.4 mg SL spray q 5 minutes MAX of 6 doses
drug_cards.notes:
*Single PCP(f) initiate then patch
Conditions for Nitroglycerin
• Patient is >= 40kg
• MAP >= 70 mmHg
• Heart rate is >= 60 and < 160 bpm
• Patient is alert
• Patients under the age of 18 require a TMP patch

drug_cards.title:
Initiate Nitroglycerin IV
MAP > 70
drug_cards.doseInformation:
10 mcg/min continuous IV infusion
MAX 100 mcg/min
Titrate q 5 minutes in 5 mcg/min increments for ischemic chest pain
Maintain Nitroglycerin infusion during transport

drug_cards.title: Maintain Nitroglycerin IV
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Maintain nitroglycerin infusion during transport under conditions listed below
• >= 18 years old
• The infusion was initiated by the sending facility
• The infusion rate <= 100 mcg/min IV and >= 5 mcg/min IV
• The patient has been chest pain free for at least 4 hours
• No change in patient condition during transport

Maintain nitroglycerin infusion during transport under conditions listed below
• >= 18 years old
• The infusion was initiated by the sending facility
• The infusion rate <= 100 mcg/min IV and >= 5 mcg/min IV
• The patient has been chest pain free for at least 4 hours
• No change in patient condition during transport

drug_cards.title: ASA
drug_cards.doseInformation:
160 mg PO, chewed and swallowed
(two 80 mg chewable tablets)
drug_cards.notes:
Conditions
• Patient weight is >= 40 kg
• No allergy to ASA
• No current active bleeding
• No evidence of CVA or head injury within 24 hours prior to onset of chest pain
• No history of asthma exacerbation from ASA ingestion

drug_cards.title: Morphine Sulfate (MSO4)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP >= 70
2 mg IV/IO q 10 minutes
MAX 6 mg

drug_cards.title: fentaNYL (Sublimaze)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP >= 70
25-50 mcg IV/IO q 5 minutes prn
MAX 300 mcg

drug_cards.title: Ticagrelor
drug_cards.doseInformation: 180 mg PO

drug_cards.title: Metoprolol
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5 mg IV/IO q 5 minutes
MAX 15 mg
If the patient is hypertensive or tachycardic

drug_cards.title: Maintain Heparin *
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Maintain Heparin infusion rate from sending if last PTT within therapeutic range of Ornge or sending hospital nomogram,
OR
If infusion initiated and no post-initiation PTT available yet

drug_cards.title: Initiate Heparin *
drug_cards.doseInformation:
80 units/kg IV bolus
MAX 5,000 units
then
INITIATE infusion 18 units/kg/hr IV
MAX 1,300 units/hr
Titrate dose relative to aPTT
drug_cards.notes:
*Contraindications to Heparin
• Active bleeding
• History of Heparin induced thrombocytopenia

directives.title: ST Elevation MI (STEMI)
directives.treatment: In patients being transported for acute cardiac intervention (emergent PCI) initiate Medical Directive and load and go. Initiate patch in pransport or pre-patch prior to arrival whenever possible.
directives.indications: • STEMI as defined by ECG changes
directives.contraindications:
Absolutate contraindications for thrombolytics
	• Suspected aortic dissection
	• Any prior intracranial hemorrhage, hemorrhagic stroke, or stroke of unknown origin
	• Known structural cerebral vascular lesion (i.e. arteriovenous malformation)
	• Known intracranial neoplasm (primary or metastatic)
	• Ischemic stroke > 3 hours or < 3 months
	• Suspected pericarditis
	• Active bleeding or bleeding diathesis (excluding menses)
	• Gastrointenstinal bleeding within the last month
	• Major trauma/surgury/head injury within three months

Relative contraindications to thrombolytics
	• Patient within 90 minutes of PCI centre from scene, consider direct transport for PCI
	OR
	• 120 minutes from PCI centre if in a community hospital
	• History of chronic, severe, poorly controlled hypertension
	• Severe uncontrolled hypertension on presentation (SBP greater than 180 mmHg or DBP > 110 mmHg)
	• History of prior ischemic stroke or transient ischemic attack within six months, dementia, or known intracranial pathology not covered in contraindications
	• Traumatic or prolonged CPR (> than ten minutes) 
	• Recent internal bleeding (within two to four weeks)
	• Noncompressible vascular punctures
	• Advanced liver disease
	• Pregnancy or within one week postpartum
	• Infective endocarditis
	• Active peptic ulcer
	• Current use of anticoagulants: the higher the INR, the higher the risk of bleeding
directives.clinical:
• No thrombolysis will be administered unless the TMP confirms diagnosis based on clinical and ECG findings and gives the order to proceed. It is preferred that the TMP review the ECG but if not possible and paramedic is confident of postivie ECG criteria then a verbal confirmation on patch with TMP is adequate
• Obtain 12 lead ECG every 15 minutes or prn for duration of transport
• Consider Plavix, Ticagrelor
• Patch if PTT parameters fall outside of norm (greater than 120 or less than 50 x 2 consecutive blood samples)

drug_cards.doseInformation: Initiate appropriate treament based on algorithm (see flowchart)

drug_cards.title: TNKase
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Patient weight (kg)	TNK (mg)	Volume (ml)
< 60 kg				30 mg		6 ml
>= 60 to < 70 kg		35 mg		7 ml
>= 70 to < 80 kg		40 mg		8 ml
>= 80 to < 90		45 mg		9 ml
>= 90 kg				50 mg		10 ml

drug_cards.title: Initiate Heparin *
drug_cards.doseInformation:
60 units/kg IV bolus
MAX 4,000 units
then
INITIATE infusion 12 units/kg/hr IV
MAX 1,000 units/hr
Titrate dose relative to aPTT
drug_cards.notes:
*Contraindications to Heparin
• Active bleeding
• History of Heparin induced thrombocytopenia

directives.title: Cardiogenic Pulmonary Edema
directives.indications:
• Initial MAP >= 70 mmHg and SBP > 100
AND
• Heart rate is >= 60 but < 160 bpm
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• No IV
• Nitroglycerin
directives.clinical:
• If a patient presents with moderate to severe respiratory distress and the Paramedic suspects the patient is in acute pulmonary edema
	• Reassess and document vitals between doses
	• Discontinue Nitroglycerin if the BP or heart rate parameters for Nitroglycerin are no longer met
	• Check blood pressure before administering each subsequent dose of Nitroglycerin

drug_cards.title: CPAP/BiPAP
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Initial Setting
iPAP 10 cmH20/ePAP 5 cmH20

MAX iPAP 20 cmH20/ePAP 10 cmH20

drug_cards.title: Nitroglycerin*
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.4 mg SL spray
q 5 minutes prn
MAX of 6 doses
drug_cards.notes: *Single PCP(f): Initiate then patch

drug_cards.title:
Nitroglycerin (Tridil)
IV Infusion (for severe pulmonary edema)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Initiate 10 mcg/min IV
titrate in 5 mcg/min incrememnts q 5 minutes
MAX 200 mcg/min

drug_cards.title: Furosemide (Lasix)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
40 mg IV or double patients usual total daily dose
MAX of 160 mg

directives.title: Cardiogenic Shock
directives.indications: • Cardiogenic shock
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
directives.clinical:
• In general, titration of Norepinephrine should be based upon MAP’s whereas respopnse to Dobutamine should be based on perfusion and clinical parameters such as urine output
• MAP parameters in cardiogenic shock should be targeted to low normal levels, MAP 60-65

drug_cards.title: Normal Saline or Ringers Lactate
drug_cards.doseInformation:
200-250 ml IV/IO bolus prn
Target MAP > 65

drug_cards.title: Norepinephrine (Levophed)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
0.05-0.5 mcg/kg/min IV/I
Target MAP > 65

drug_cards.title: doBUTamine (Dobutrex)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5-20 mcg/kg/min IV/IO
Initiate at 5 mcg/kg/min
Titrate based on perfusion and clinical parameters

directives.title: Intra-Aortic Ballon Pump (IABP)
directives.treatment:
• Paramedics are required to perform IABP specific assessments
	• Verify Balloon position and size
	• Identify balloon tip on x-ray
	• Assess for distal pulses in insertion limb
	• Assess for urine output
	• Identify if catheter is fiber optic
	• Identify trigger being used
	• Assess IABP waveform
	• Ensure catheter is sutured securely in place
directives.indications:
• A CCP may provide the treatment prescribed in this auxiliary medical directive if certified and authorized
• Patient > 18 years old
• Patient > 40 kg
• Patient must already be on Intra-Aortic Balloon Pump (IABP) at the sending hospital
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable
directives.clinical:
• 1 IABP certified paramedic with >= ACP(f) partner
• Paramedics are not permitted to advance or remove IABP catheters
• Paramedics are required to ensure transport IABP is in ready state, fully charged, appropriate helium levels, paper role, and appropriate cables

drug_cards.title: Paramedics are required to Patch to obtain orders when providing IABP care
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Transition
• Both paramedics at the bedside for transition to transport IABP
• Put IABP in 1:2 ratio
• Select trigger
• Assess and adjust 3 rules of timing to achieve ideal waveform and augmentation
• Run a recording strip
• Maintain head of bed no higher than 30 degrees
• Keep insertion limb straight
• Ensure no blood is present in the catheter
• Return IABP ratio to 1:1 or 1:2 matching setting from sending

Transport
• Excercise caution to protect IABP catheter from being pulled
• Continuously monitor the patient and the performance of the IABP, make adjustment required to maintain good augmentation
• Run a recorder strip at the start of transport and again at the end of transport
• Plug IABP into vehicle power source to conserve IABP internal battery

Transfer of Care
• Paramedics to ensure sage transfer of IABP care with accepting hospital staff
• Run final strip prior to transfer
• Document as required on ACR among other care the specifics of the IABP

directives.title: Stroke
directives.indications: • Acute stroke
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• Traumatic head injury
• Blood glucose < 4 mmol

drug_cards.title: Labetalol
drug_cards.doseInformation:
• 10-20 mg slow IV push q 20 minutes prn until desired MAP achieved
• Infusion 0.5 - 2 mg/min
drug_cards.notes:
Hold if HR < 60 bmp
MAX dose 300 mg/day

drug_cards.title: Hypertonic Saline
drug_cards.doseInformation:
3 ml/kg IV/IO
MAX rate of 20 ml/min

drug_cards.title: Mannitol
drug_cards.doseInformation: 1 g/kg IV/IO bolus

directives.title: Adult Seizures
directives.indications: • Active seizure
directives.contraindications:
• Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
• If blood glucose level <= 4 mmol/L, proceed with protocol for “Hypoglycemic Emergencies”
directives.clinical: • 0.2 micron filter must be used when administering phenyTOIN

drug_cards.title: Midazolam (Versed) for seizures
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5 mg IV/IO doses repeated every 5 minutes, until seizure termination or MAX dose 0.2 mg/kg IV/IO in total
OR
10 mg IM if no IV/IO access

drug_cards.title: phenyTOIN (Dilantin)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
20 mg/kg add to 250 ml NS IV/IO
Infusion should be no faster than 25 mg/min

USE NORMAL SALINE ONLY
phenyTOIN will precipitate in dextrose solutions

drug_cards.title: Propofol
drug_cards.doseInformation:
50 mg IV/IO q 5 minutes prn if MAP > 70
Prepare to intubate

directives.title: Combative Patient
directives.indications:
• In the event that a patient becomes agitated or combative, thereby endangering themselves and/or others on board the vehicle, ALL Paramedics are expected to: Physically restrain the patient as per MOHLTC Basic Life Support - Patient Care Standards
• Assess the patient for medical causes of agitation (i.e. hypoxemia, hypoglycemia, etc.)
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication
directives.clinical:
• In patients with a primary psychiatric diagnosis, if time permits, contact TMP for Haloperidol (Haldol)
• Notify the Flight Crew immediately if in an aircraft

drug_cards.title: Ketamine (Ketalar)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
1-2 mg/kg IV/IO* over 1-3 minutes
OR
3-5 mg/kg IM
drug_cards.notes: High IV doses of Ketamine should be given slow push to reduce risk of apnea

drug_cards.title: Midazolam (Versed)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 70
0.05 mg/kg IV/IO
OR
0.1 mg/kg IM q 5 minutes prn
MAX dose 0.2 mg/kg

directives.title: Adult Symptomatic Bradycardia
directives.indications: • Symptomatic Bradycardia with a pulse
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication

drug_cards.title: Atropine
drug_cards.doseInformation: 0.5 mg IV/IO initial dose (repeat q 3-5 minutes to max total dose 3 mg)

drug_cards.title: Dopamine
drug_cards.doseInformation:
5-20 mcg/kg/min IV
Target MAP > 65
drug_cards.notes: Patients with bradycardia requiring transcutaneous (TC) pacing who are conscious and aware of their surroundings may require sedation and analgesia prior to TC pacing. Below are directives for sedation and analgesia for TC pacing. Patients that are peri-arrest can be immediately TC paced without sedation or analgesia.

drug_cards.title: Transcutaneous Cardiac Pacing
drug_cards.doseInformation:
Set pacing rate at 70, start output at 10 milliamps (mA) and increase to achieve electrical capture with a pulse (mechanical capture)
Once mechanical capture has been confirmed increase mA by 10%
Confirm the presence of a pulse and assess blood pressure and perfusion

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

directives.title: Transvenous Cardiac Pacing
directives.indications: • Transvenous pacing, if initiated at the sending facility
directives.contraindications: • Not applicable
directives.clinical: • Monitor the cardiac rhythm and ensure the catheter/cable is carefully secured to prevent inadvertent tension or traction on the line

drug_cards.doseInformation: Maintain transvenous pacing if initated at sending facility (initial pacing settings will reflect sending facility settings)
Any alteration of settings to be discussed with TMP

directives.title:
Adult Symptomatic Atrial Fibrillation 
Flutter
directives.indications:
• Symptomatic Atrial Flutter
• Symptomatic Atrial Fibrillation
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication

drug_cards.doseInformation: Synchronized Cardioversion

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

directives.title: Adult Paroxysmal Supraventricular Tachycardia (PSVT)
directives.indications: • Paroxysmal Supraventricular Tachycardia (PSVT)
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication

drug_cards.doseInformation: Synchronized Cardioversion

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Adenosine
drug_cards.doseInformation:
6 mg rapid IV/IO with 20 ml NS flush
Repeat at 12 mg x 1 prn

directives.title: Adult Ventricular Tachycardia with Perfusion
directives.indications: • Ventricular Tachycardia (VT) with a pulse
directives.contraindications: • Allergy or sensitivity to the medication

drug_cards.doseInformation: Synchronized Cardioversion
drug_cards.notes: Patients with VT with a pulse who are conscious and aware of their surroundings may require sedation and analgesia prior to cardioversion. Patients that are peri-arrest of hemodynamically unstable can be immediately cardioverted with synchronized cardioversion with sedation or analgesia.

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Procedural Sedation
drug_cards.doseInformation:
MAP > 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg
OR
Versed 0.05 mg/kg and/or
Fentanyl 1 mcg/kg

MAP < 65
Ketamine 0.5 mg/kg

drug_cards.title: Amiodarone (Cordarone)
drug_cards.doseInformation:
150 mg IV over 10 minutes
(may repeat x 1 as adjunct to cardioversion)

directives.title: Intravenous Line Initiation
directives.indications: • Actual or potential need for intravenous or fluid therapy
directives.contraindications: • Suspected fracture proximal to the IV site
directives.clinical: • A PCP(f) may provide the treatment prescrubed in this auxiliary medical directive if certified and authorized

drug_cards.title: Initiate IV
drug_cards.doseInformation: MAX of 2 peripheral IV lines may be established

directives.title: Blood Sampling and Lab Value Interpretation
Maintaining and Accessing Central Venous Lines
Extravasation of Vasopressors from Peripheral IV Infusion
Advanced Active Management of the Third Stage
